2_1EvouJCSru1YAbXsZW6WtRa97eLP4UjqKo.body:
> [m1nistry](#comment_7_1CiW4yN81LYyrDsMsZpM7PBvz4EsZqLZZ1): Backing up your data/users.json file will allow you to keep your username identity. It contains the keys needed to authenticate. It uses the same setup for storing bitcoin wallets as far as I know.

Can you protect it with a password ? (just in case someone access to this file)

> [zyx](#comment_6_1DUxbFE7rbRQrzXQigk1VSzeqdaAJpwBvH): You could always pack it in a 7-zip or rar file with a password on :)

Yeah, having something like that in mind, but I think it's better when the system ask for my password when I try to login, just in case I forgot to lock my computer ^^

1_16Qxab7SNiZ2R9xV1tJQLXbCiWiXyxeELZ.body:
> [gkittz](#comment_2_17iY4QsDEmdCkJywu7Nds2svrDJDEQ24bh): That means, I'm hosting the whole zerotalk site right now?? That would make it impossible to load big sites? won't it...

That's the magic of P2P, big sites will load smoothly if many user have a copy. And that's why twitter use P2P technology to update datacenter. But of course, if only you host the big site, the loading time increase.
